info.name: Auditor
info.description: The Auditor Background from Morgrave Miscellany.
info.author: Keith Baker & Ruty Rutenberg

description.p: You don’t work with taxes or accounts. Your job is testing security systems, finding the flaws in vaults, prisons, and other secure systems. Most auditors work for the Warding Guild of House Kundarak, testing locks, traps, and other Kundarak creations. You could also have worked for the Warning Guild of House Medani, helping to spot threats before they occur. In those days, locks and wards were something you studied for your job; now you’re putting your skills to practical use as an adventurer.

ul.li: Tool Proficiencies: Thieves’ Tools, Tinker’s Tools
Equipment: Thieves’ Tools, a set of common clothes, an Auditor’s badge, a pouch with 5 gp

description.p: You have a critical eye, and you’re always looking for weaknesses and trying to find ways that things can be improved.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I’m always pointing out peoples’ flaws, for their own good.
I always have a suggestion as to how something could be improved.
I try to get to know everyone; it makes finding weaknesses easier.
I question every decision. It’s the only way to find the best answer.
I want to test every limit, looking for patterns, sequences, and cyphers when I’m bored.
I hate to waste time. Get to work.
I’m always speculating about possible threats.
I’m suspicious of everyone and everything.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Perfection. A perfect world is one in which everything is foolproof, and nothing can be broken. (Lawful)
Security. The world is a dangerous place, and everyone should be able to feel safe. Do what you can to help give innocent people a sense of security. (Good)
Freedom. Nothing should be hidden. No door should be barred. Those who wish should have access to every path and every secret. (Chaotic)
Neighborly. Helping people establish strong defenses is a way to maintain one’s relationships and financial securities. (Neutral)
Domination. The perfect system is one that I control. (Evil)
Efficiency. Anything can be improved, and I’m always looking for ways to do it. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I have a loved one that I would do anything form as long as they are safe.
I want to help friends achieve peak efficiency.
I’m going to pull off the heist of the century, but I need a team I can trust.
A criminal mastermind used me to commit a crime. I’m on the run, trying to clear my name.
My mentor was locked away behind impenetrable defenses. I aim to crack them.
I uncovered a secret I wasn’t meant to know and now it haunts my dreams.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I’m always looking for weaknesses in the people and things around me.
I’m never satisfied; there’s always a way to improve things.
I’m paranoid, always imagining threats I have to defend against.
I push everything and everyone to find their breaking point. Nothing is true until tested.
I’m always hungry for new challenges.
My instincts seem more trustworthy to me than my allies.

description.p: You have an excellent memory for traps and security structures and can always recall the general construction of such apparatus, including their triggers. You can also find blueprints of a specific trap in order to learn the details of its application. Such blueprints might provide knowledge of points of weakness, possible advancements, and magic or mechanisms that might trigger them. Your access to such information isn’t unlimited. If obtaining or using the information gets you in trouble with the law, your affiliation can’t shield you from the repercussions.
